My wife and I had room 224, back toward the pool.  We were a little worried about staying here because it has a sketchy reputation, but we were desperate for a  budget place to stay.   Pros:  Inexpensive, clean to the naked eye,quiet and the toilet didn't leak. Cons:  Not well maintained (two light bulbs out), in need of painting and other matters, dark even after replacing the bulbs and does not have a mini-fridge. I would not stay here for a week while sightseeing, but would use it for a quick one night stay.

This motel sounds really great and I was looking forward to staying there.  However, it's impossible to get a reservation.  First, they do not have an on-line system.  Second, when I called, it was too far in advance -- they only take them within a couple weeks of your stay or something.  Third, when I finally called back closer to the date, they said they could not hold my reservation after 6 PM, which is before my arrival time.  None of this is stated on their website.  So don't bother if you need some normal conveniences for planning.

I have stayed at this motel a dozen times...the family who owns it are nice and friendly. I highly recommend it for the budget minded. The rooms aren't too extravagant but they work and clean. The pool is clean and laundry is clean.Located in a hidden are its safer than those bigger places. easy to get to Disneyland and Knotts Berryfarm as well as many food places.Again its family owned and operated..very family oriented place  I give it 3 and half stars out of 5 .Like I said we have been going there for 10 years plus and never get any surprises its always a good place to stay .Weekends are full in summer sometimes so call ahead and book early . Economy but clean is what this place is so save money and stay in this motel.They are missing some things like a refrig and cooking

I am not sure why there is a bad review on this motel. It is an excellent deal for Anaheim. The rates, tax inclusive, are $54 weekdays and $66 on weekends, holidays, and special events.  The room is very clean, quite large, and has a comfortable couch. There are non-smoking rooms available as well. The desk staff, all of them, are very friendly. There is also a 200-channel satellite TV. The bed is very comfortable and affords a pleasant sleep.  Public transportation options are great as well.   There is a bus that goes to Los Cerritos Mall (about a 45-minute ride) if you wish to shop. The bus stop is right across the street in front of a Del Taco. Summary: Looking for a last minute room in the Anaheim area, after reading a couple reviews, I decided to try the Akua. It was as promised, clean and convenient. It is definitely no frills. The room was clean and neat. There was a big screen TV and comfy bed. You can upgrade to a room with two beds or a frig if you want. I opted for the ice-maker, which in the long run cost me less than the $2 charge for the frig. The AC is located back by the sink, so it can be cool to wash your hands ;) It did a good job of cooling the room. There is soap, but no shampoo, etc. The towels were basic as well, but effective. Summary Heading: Good place if your not looking for something super faNCY OR EXPENSIVE
Summary: I personally like AKUA's prices those are my favorites. The rooms are fine nothing to special. Just make sure you stay more up towards the front rather than in the back. The only problem is that rooms with fridges and microwaves are more towards the back. But still I would stay here sometimes just to getaway from family and relax.

While not the absolute best-ever lodging experience the Akua offers a nice clean restful environment. Owner is a great lady who'e run the place for many years and still acts as if she cares. Good place for business travelers even during the Obama years when there is little or no business! Dreat rates!

This was the cheapest and closest hotel to where I was having a meeting in the morning and I was surprised that it was pretty nice. The rooms were clean (I was surprised to see the other review)  - and I had a quiet sleep. They also had some cute landscaping around, something you wouldn't expect from a budget motel (you can't beat $40 a night). The staff were professional. Only drawback is that it is located in an industrial part of town although there are some restaurants close by.
